H0.text: Oil is the most common source of nonrenewable resources used to generate electricity in the state of Nevada.

H1.text: Coal is the most common source of nonrenewable resources used to generate electricity in the state of Nevada.

H2.text: Geothermal is the most common source of nonrenewable resources used to generate electricity in the state of Nevada.

H3.text: Hydroelectric is the most common source of nonrenewable resources used to generate electricity in the state of Nevada.
